meanings.definition: A person who does tedious, menial, or unpleasant work.
meanings.sent1: The drudges in the kitchen washed dishes all day.
meanings.sent2: The factory employed many drudges to handle repetitive tasks.
meanings.sent3: The drudges in the storybook were actually magical creatures in disguise.
meanings.sent4: The drudges of society keep the wheels turning behind the scenes.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tired drudges trudging home at sunset stayed with her.

meanings.definition: To do hard, menial, or tedious work.
meanings.sent1: She drudges through her homework every evening.
meanings.sent2: The workers drudged away under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: He drudges through the clutter in his room, searching for his lost keys.
meanings.sent4: The students drudged through the final exam, hoping for a passing grade.
meanings.sent5: The gardener drudges tirelessly to keep the flowers blooming beautifully.
